p: The chikungunya virus is a positive-sense single-stranded RNA virus classified into the genus Alphavirus of the Togaviridae family [ 3]. It has three genotypes, namely the West African, East/Central/South African (ECSA), and Asian genotypes [ 4]. Since 2005, the ECSA genotype has caused epidemics that have spread from East Africa to Indian Ocean islands, India, and Southeast Asia, and it has caused indigenous clusters for the first time in many regions, including the Middle East and Europe. Since 2013, the Asian genotype has caused major clusters for the first time in the Americas and the Pacific islands [ 5].
